sub_title: Showing the route towards a sustainable society (respecting Planet & People & sharing Prosperity)
summary:
Associate Professor Governance of Sustainable Production & Consumption at Utrecht University (NL), with special focus on global sustainable supply chain governance; corporate sustainability strategies and reverse supply chain: implementing circular economy strategies.

Past-President of  the International Sustainable Development Research Society (see www.isdrs.org).

Former Program Leader International Master on Sustainable Development, Utrecht University, also linked to the International Joint Degree Program Sustainable Development (see www.jointdegree.eu).ociety (see www.isdrs.org).

Extraordinary Associate Professor, Sustainability Institute, Stellenbosch University (SA).

FOR THE UPDATED PUBLICATIONS: See https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Walter_Vermeulen 

==============

Key research focus on governance systems for sustainability in global value chains (supplier side and post consumer side: circular economy)

Teaching on Business, Sustainability and Innovation; and innovative approaches in governance.

Specialties: 
* Social scientific analysis of practices of governance for sustainable development, collaborative approaches by market and civil society and governments;
* Focus on sustainability of globally traded products; creating shared 3P value
* Academic teaching in these areas.

projects.title: Sustainability of international supply-chains
projects.description: Making international supply chains more sustainable can be done in various ways. The main options are: improve production processes, increase the efficiency of resource use; and alter consumption patterns. These options can help to reduce the human footprint of consumption; both the "size" of the footprint (extent in terms of land- and water-use) and its "depth" (environmental and social impact). Much progress has been made with the first option. A number of traded resources and products, such as coffee, timber, palm oil, cocoa, fish and soy, nowadays carry a sustainability label. These labels guarantee that resources have been produced with respect for the local environment and working conditions.

profile_positions.description:
Associate Professor Utrecht University.
Research in Governance for Sustainable Development: joint market, NGO and government approaches for sustainable production and consumption. Sustainable Development in Global Trade and International Supply Chains. Analysis of Corporate Sustainability. Research in the transition to circular economy.
Program Leader of the International Master in Sustainable Development (2007-2014)
profile_positions.title: Professor (Associate) of Governance of Sustainable Production and Consumption, Utrecht University
Member of Duurzaamheidsraad (Local advice council on sustainability)

profile_positions.description: After 6 years of presidency and 2 years vice president I still promote the role of the ISDR Society in the global community of research and practice; with its annual conferences.
profile_positions.title: Past President

profile_positions.description: Convene meetings with science and practitioners
